channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesota Olympians, other athletes speak up about federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: "I want to make sure you know who I'm racing for," wrote Minnesota-born cross-country skiing star Jessie Diggins. Meanwhile, a hospitality center for Team USA families dropped the name "Ice House."
item.content:encoded:
"I want to make sure you know who I'm racing for," wrote Minnesota-born cross-country skiing star Jessie Diggins. Meanwhile, a hospitality center for Team USA families dropped the name "Ice House."

(Image credit: Matthias Hangst)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Populist conservative Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
item.description: Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.
item.content:encoded:
Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started by her predecessor.

(Image credit: Carlos Borbon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What Jared Kushner's 'New Gaza' plan includes, and what it leaves out
item.description: President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner laid out a plan for a "New Gaza." A close look suggests it makes room for fewer Palestinians and less housing.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner laid out a plan for a "New Gaza." A close look suggests it makes room for fewer Palestinians and less housing.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Trump administration sued over visa freeze on immigrants from 75 countries
item.description: A group of nonprofit organizations and U.S. citizens Monday filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's sweeping suspension of immigrant visa processing for people from nearly half of the world's countries.
item.content:encoded:
A group of nonprofit organizations and U.S. citizens Monday filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's sweeping suspension of immigrant visa processing for people from nearly half of the world's countries.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: U.S. sledder Katie Uhlaender appeal denied, won't race at Milan Cortina Olympics
item.description: International officials say a point-rigging scheme denied American Katie Uhlaender a shot to compete in the Milan Cortina Olympics. But a sports tribunal based in Switzerland says it can't intervene.
item.content:encoded:
International officials say a point-rigging scheme denied American Katie Uhlaender a shot to compete in the Milan Cortina Olympics. But a sports tribunal based in Switzerland says it can't intervene.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: The Trump Administration exempts new nuclear reactors from environmental review
item.description: The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.
item.content:encoded:
The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.

(Image credit: Idaho National Laboratory)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: The 'Melania' movie audience: Older white women
item.description: The pricey Amazon documentary did well in areas like Dallas, Tampa, Phoenix, Houston, Atlanta and West Palm Beach. Amazon says a docuseries is also on the way.
item.content:encoded:
The pricey Amazon documentary did well in areas like Dallas, Tampa, Phoenix, Houston, Atlanta and West Palm Beach. Amazon says a docuseries is also on the way.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: Trump says he's closing the Kennedy Center for renovations. We have questions
item.description: After President Trump announced plans for a "Complete Rebuilding" of the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., what exactly did he mean, and what does it mean for the arts?
item.content:encoded:
After President Trump announced plans for a "Complete Rebuilding" of the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., what exactly did he mean, and what does it mean for the arts?

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: A major census test faces cutbacks — with postal workers tapped to help count
item.description: The Trump administration has shrunk the number of locations for this year's field test of the 2030 census and has added plans to test replacing temporary census workers with U.S. Postal Service staff.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has shrunk the number of locations for this year's field test of the 2030 census and has added plans to test replacing temporary census workers with U.S. Postal Service staff.

(Image credit: John Raoux)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: N.Y. Republican met with jeers over ICE tactics during town hall in swing district
item.description: Discontent over ICE enforcement tactics is spilling out into races across the country, including competitive congressional districts held by Republicans, like Rep. Mike Lawler of New York.
item.content:encoded:
Discontent over ICE enforcement tactics is spilling out into races across the country, including competitive congressional districts held by Republicans, like Rep. Mike Lawler of New York.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Steve Kastenbaum
